title: style: function declarations violate style guide in SocketPoll_backend.h
body:
**File**: `/home/tetsuo/git/tetsuo-socket/include/poll/SocketPoll_backend.h`
**Category**: Code Style / Refactoring
**Severity**: LOW
**Pattern**: STYLE_RETURN_LINE

## Issue Description

All function declarations in `SocketPoll_backend.h` have their return types on the same line as the function name, violating the project style guide.

## Affected Lines

- Line 556: `extern PollBackend_T backend_new (...)`
- Line 623: `extern void backend_free (...)`
- Line 697: `extern int backend_add (...)`
- Line 762: `extern int backend_mod (...)`
- Line 776: `extern int backend_del (...)`
- Line 792: `extern int backend_wait (...)`
- Line 812: `extern int backend_get_event (...)`
- Line 828: `extern const char *backend_name (...)`

## Project Style Guide

From `CLAUDE.md` line 203:
> Return type on separate line from function name

All `.c` files in the project follow this pattern (e.g., `src/poll/SocketPoll_epoll.c`):
```c
static unsigned
translate_to_epoll (unsigned events)
```

## Recommendation

Update all function declarations to split return type onto separate line:

**Before**:
```c
extern PollBackend_T backend_new (Arena_T arena, int maxevents);
```

**After**:
```c
extern PollBackend_T
backend_new (Arena_T arena, int maxevents);
```

## Impact

- Improves consistency across codebase
- Makes code match established style guide
- No functional changes required
